news_scraper.db_operation_api package¶

Submodules¶

news_scraper.db_operation_api.mydb module¶

This module abstracts some common SQL operations.

news_scraper.db_operation_api.mydb.LOG_FORMAT¶

str – log format for the “logging” module

Example

database = get_database(DATABASE_CONFIG)
with database as conn:
    rows = conn.get_fields_by_conditions("table_name",("title", "content"), {"id": 1})
print(rows)
class news_scraper.db_operation_api.mydb.MyDB(db_host, db_user, db_password, db_port, database, verbose)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for database connectors (such as PostgreSqlDB).

This should not be instanciated directly. Please inherit it and override at least the following methods:

  • __init__()
  • open()
  • execute_sql_command()
close()[source]¶

Close the database connection.

db_already_exists(db_name)[source]¶

Check whether a database exists in the database.

Parameters:db_name (str) – Name of the database to check
Returns:bool – True if the database already exists. False otherwise.
execute_sql_command(query, *args)[source]¶

Must be overridden by derived classes.

get_fields_by_conditions(table_name, field_list, condition_map=None)[source]¶

Get values in the database specified by the filed list.

This is encapsulates the “SELECT {} FROM {} WHERE {};” SQL queries.

Parameters:
  • table_name (str) – Name of the database to get valuse
  • field_list (list(str)) – Fields to get values
  • condition_map (dict, optional) – <key, value> pairs of the conditions used in the “WHERE” statement of the SQL query.
Returns:

list(tuple) – All rows of the query result.
insert_values_into_table(table_name, args_map)[source]¶

Insert values into a table in the database.

Parameters:
  • table_name (str) – Name of the table to insert values
  • args_map (dict) – <key, value> pairs to insert to the talbe.
open()[source]¶

Must be overridden by derived classes.

reset_table(table_name)[source]¶

Delete all data inside a table.

Note that this will NOT delete the table itself.

Parameters:table_name (str) – Name of the table to reset
table_already_exists(table_name)[source]¶

Check whether a table exists in the database.

Parameters:table_name (str) – Name of the table to check
Returns:bool – True if the table already exists. False otherwise.
update_table(table_name, args_map, condition_map)[source]¶

Update table entries into the database.

Parameters:
  • table_name (str) – Name of the table to update values
  • args_map (dict) – <key, value> pairs to update to the table.
  • condition_map (dict, optional) – <key, value> pairs of the conditions used in the “WHERE” statement of the SQL query.
exception news_scraper.db_operation_api.mydb.MyDBError[source]¶

Bases: RuntimeError

Exceptions that will be raised by MyDB.

class news_scraper.db_operation_api.mydb.PostgreSqlDB(db_host, db_user, db_password, db_port=5432, database='template1', verbose=False)[source]¶

Bases: news_scraper.db_operation_api.mydb.MyDB

APIs for common operations to a PostgreSQL database.

An instance acts like the combination of a datbase connection and a database cursor.

Note that it is recommended to use this class with the “with” statement, which will call self.open() implicitly.

db_host¶

str – Hostname of the database.

db_user¶

str – Username of the database.

db_password¶

str – Username of the database.

db_port¶

int, optional – Port of the database. Defaults to 5432.

database¶

str, optional – The database to use. Defaults to “template1”

verbose¶

bool, optional – Whether to show debugging information.

execute_sql_command(query, *args)[source]¶

Executes a SQL command.

This actualy pass the arguments to psycopg2.cursor.execute(query, args).

Parameters:
  • query (str) – The SQL query to execute. Variables are specified by positional (%s) placeholders.
  • *args – Variables specified by %s placeholders in the “query” argument.
Returns:

list(tuple) – All rows of the query result.
Raises:

psycopg2.ProgrammingError – If there are any error in the query.
open()[source]¶

Opens a database connection.

This initializes self._conn by calling psycopg2.connect()

Returns:self
Raises:MyDBError – 1. If there the connection has been opened. 2. If fails to establish a databae cursor.
news_scraper.db_operation_api.mydb.get_database(DATABASE_CONFIG)[source]¶

Get an instance of the database (subclass of MyDB).

Parameters:DATABASE_CONFIG (dict) – Database configuration.
Returns:MyDB – An instance of a subclass of MyDB.
